meanings.definition: A rough woolen fabric, typically of mixed flecked colors.
meanings.sent1: She wore a cozy jacket made of tweeds to stay warm.
meanings.sent2: The tailor displayed a variety of tweeds in his shop.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a clue in the tweeds left at the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: The landscape painter captured the essence of the countryside in his tweeds.
meanings.sent5: The tweeds felt scratchy against his skin, but he loved the rustic look.

meanings.sent1: He admired the classic style of her tweeds.
meanings.sent2: The fashion show featured models in elegant tweeds.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about wearing tweeds to a fancy gala.
meanings.sent4: Her tweeds stood out in a sea of modern attire.
meanings.sent5: The tweeds added a touch of sophistication to his wardrobe.
